thread.title: Rise up : Bruce Springsteen wows Christchurch on emotional night - Yahoo New Zealand
thread.title_full: Rise up : Bruce Springsteen wows Christchurch on emotional night - Yahoo New Zealand

author: Yahoo New Zealand On February
title: Rise up : Bruce Springsteen wows Christchurch on emotional night - Yahoo New Zealand
text:
Share Rise up : Bruce Springsteen wows Christchurch on emotional night - Yahoo New Zealand Tears were rolling as thousands turned out to see Bruce Springsteen perform on an emotionally charged night on the eve of the sixth anniversary of the 2011 earthquake. Close 'Rise up': Bruce Springsteen wows Christchurch on emotional night UP NEXT VIDEO 'Rise up': Bruce Springsteen wows Christchurch on emotional night. Source: YouTube/Gwyn Clarke 'Rise up': Bruce Springsteen wows Christchurch on emotional night 
'The Boss', who purposely scheduled his Christchurch concert to mark the sixth anniversary, stood in solidarity with Cantabrians, delivering a heartfelt performance that left party-goers wowed. 
As Springsteen emerged from back stage, he greeted the crowded with the words, "Hello Christchurch". 
During the gig, the American rocker held u a 'We love Christchurch' sign, which received a roar of applause from the packed house. Bruce Springsteen holds up a 'We love Christchurch' sign during his gig at AMI stadium. Photo: Screengrab/1 News 
Springsteen performed My City Of Ruins, a song which became an unofficial anthem for the city following the deadly 2011 quake that killed 185 people. 
Hundreds waved 'I love Christchurch' signs as the sold out crowd sung along in high spirits. 
Springsteen now heads to Auckland where he'll perform at Mt Smart Stadium on February 25.
